extracted_sections.section_title: Montgolfier Brothers’ First Hot‑Air Balloon Flights

subsection_analysis.refined_text: Aerospace power includes both civilian and military aerospace communities. Without the aeronautical advances brought about by military applications of aircraft, technology might not have progressed beyond the Wright Flyer level.
On October 15, 1783, Pilâtre de Rozier and the Marquis d'Arlandes made the first free hot‑air balloon flight, demonstrating controlled ascent and descent via heated air.
In 1804, Sir George Cayley's whirling‑arm experiments measured lift and drag, leading to his first model fixed‑wing glider—foundational to heavier‑than‑air aircraft.
